# Static Configurations


<!-- WARNING: THIS FILE WAS AUTOGENERATED! DO NOT EDIT! -->

## Imports

## Configuration Class

The
[`Config`](https://michaeltheologitis.github.io/thucy/configuration.html#config)
class manages all configuration through a combination of default values
and environment variables loaded from `.env`.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/michaeltheologitis/thucy/blob/main/thucy/configuration.py#L15"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Config

>  Config ()

*Global configuration for the thucy project*

### Singleton Instance

We create a single global `config` instance that can be imported
throughout the project.

<details open class="code-fold">
<summary>Exported source</summary>

``` python
config = Config()
```

</details>

``` python
config.restore_defaults()
```

``` python
config.show_config()
```

    OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-xxyy
    EXPERTS_MODEL=gpt-5-mini
    LEAD_MODEL=gpt-5
    SQL_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    SCHEMA_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    DATA_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    GENAI_SERVER_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000
    LEAD_MAX_TURNS=40

### Usage Examples

The following cells demonstrate how to set and retrieve environment
variables using the config system.

Check if variable exists before setting it:

``` python
import os
```

``` python
os.getenv("SQL_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS")
```

    '30'

Set the variable and verify itâ€™s saved:

``` python
config.set_env_var('SQL_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS', 5)
```

``` python
os.getenv("SQL_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS")
```

    '5'

``` python
config.sql_expert_max_turns
```

    5

``` python
config.set_env_var('EXPERTS_MODEL', 'gpt-5.1')
```

``` python
os.getenv("EXPERTS_MODEL")
```

    'gpt-5.1'

Access via config object (lowercase attribute):

``` python
config.experts_model
```

    'gpt-5.1'

Restore to original default values:

``` python
config.restore_defaults()
```

``` python
config.show_config()
```

    OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-xxyy
    EXPERTS_MODEL=gpt-5-mini
    LEAD_MODEL=gpt-5
    SQL_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    SCHEMA_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    DATA_EXPERT_MAX_TURNS=30
    GENAI_SERVER_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000
    LEAD_MAX_TURNS=40

``` python
config.lead_max_turns
```

    40

### append_to_file

>  append_to_file (filename:str, data:pydantic.main.BaseModel,
>                      general_tag:str)

*Append the attributes of a Pydantic BaseModel instance to a file within
a general tag.*

<table>
<colgroup>
<col style="width: 9%" />
<col style="width: 38%" />
<col style="width: 52%" />
</colgroup>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>filename</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>filename to append to</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>data</td>
<td>BaseModel</td>
<td>a Pydantic BaseModel instance with attributes to log</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>general_tag</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>a general tag to wrap around the data</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
class TestBucket(BaseModel):
    name: str = "TestBucket"
    size: int = 10
    region: str = "us-west-1"

append_to_file("test_log.txt", data=TestBucket(), general_tag="CONFIGURATION")
```

``` python
with open(config.results_dir / "test_log.txt", "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
    print(f.read())
```


    <CONFIGURATION>
    <name>
    TestBucket
    </name>
    <size>
    10
    </size>
    <region>
    us-west-1
    </region>
    </CONFIGURATION>

``` python
os.remove(config.results_dir / "test_log.txt")
```
